message: Dear Bob, I am excited to present our product to you. It is a unique opportunity that I believe would greatly benefit your business. I am offering it to you for $1,200,000. I hope we can come to an agreement that satisfies both parties.
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I recognize the value of the product; however, I have a more conservative budget in mind.  Would you consider a price of $650,000?

Thank you for your response, Bob. I appreciate your interest in our product. While I understand your budget constraints, I am unable to accept $650,000 for the product. I am proposing a counteroffer of $750,000. This price still reflects the value of the product and allows us to maintain a reasonable profit margin. I look forward to your consideration of this offer.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice.  While $750,000 is closer to what I had in mind, I'm still aiming for a slightly lower price point. Would you be open to $700,000?

I understand your position, Bob, and I appreciate your effort to find a mutually beneficial solution. After careful consideration, I am prepared to offer the product to you for $725,000. This price reflects the value of the product while allowing us to maintain a reasonable profit margin. I hope this proposal aligns better with your budgetary considerations.
